metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16129 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The HTTP client module superagent is vulnerable to ZIP bomb attacks. In a ZIP bomb attack, the HTTP server replies with a compressed response that becomes several magnitudes larger once uncompressed. If a client does not take special care when processing such responses, it may result in excessive CPU and/or memory consumption. An attacker might exploit such a weakness for a DoS attack. To exploit this the attacker must control the location (URL) that superagent makes a request to.

criterions.comment: node-superagent: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
